intro: Phyllanthus youngii, commonly known as the African butterbean, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, greenish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain small, round seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and potential medicinal research.
